Summary Note:
Gisèle Déborah Riedo and the RM met at a networking event in Rome. They quickly realized they had complementary skills and decided to collaborate on several projects.
With a career spanning nearly 42 years, Gisèle Déborah Riedo has established herself as a key player in the industry.
She was drawn to Julius Baer's holistic financial planning and investment strategies, prompting the decision to join.
Family Background: Gisèle Déborah Riedo is married to Schneider. They do not have any children.
Education Background:
Gisèle earned her secondary school diploma from Kantonsschule Zürich Nord Zurich in 1978.
Gisèle completed her university education at ETH Zurich in 1982.
Occupation History:
Gisèle Déborah Riedo is a 65 year old retired Venture Capitalist from Italy. She has a diverse background, having worked in various capacities and gained extensive knowledge in the field.
At Roche S.p.A., Gisèle Déborah Riedo held the position of Research Scientist from 1983 to 1984, developing essential skills in the field.
At Novartis Farma S.p.A., she held the position of Biotech Startup Founder from 1985 to 1987, making significant contributions to the organization.
Her tenure as a CEO at Novartis Farma S.p.A. from 1987 to 1992 was marked by significant achievements and a deepening understanding of the field.
In 1992, she transitioned to Novartis Farma S.p.A. to take on the position of Venture Capitalist, capitalizing on her expertise to propel business growth.
Wealth Summary:
She managed to save approximately 2690000 EUR from her earnings at all companies.
She has house located in Milan, worth 1280000 EUR.

She does not have any inheritances.
Client Summary: Based on the information provided, we are excited about the client's financial journey and look forward to supporting her in achieving her financial goals.
